snippet: An American official warned there was only so much the troops could do in a country beleaguered by civilian massacres, rape and the destruction of food supplies....
abstract: South Sudan's beleaguered government, bowing to intentional pressure, will allow 4,000 additional United Nations peacekeepers into country; troops will supplement existing force of 14,000 soldiers, police and military observers.
lead_paragraph: An American official warned there was only so much the troops could do in a country beleaguered by civilian massacres, rape and the destruction of food supplies.

headline.main: South Sudan to Allow More U.N. Peacekeepers, but Force Will Be No ‘Panacea’
headline.print_headline: South Sudan to Accept  More U.N. Peacekeepers
